data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3551877,"name":null,"username":"object-oriented","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/o/e274bd/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-09T15:05:00.476Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eI asked my team to buy 2 one meter addressable led strips so that we could put them on both sides of our elevator. I am now aware that the rio’s pwm port only supports one really long strip and not multiple plugged in at the same time. I would wire them in series but these strips aren’t exactly suited for that. They have a silicone cover and to wire another strip in series I would have to cut it open and do a really tough solder. Am I able to wire them in parallel on the same pwm port? I’m most likely gonna display the same thing on both strips regardless if I can address both or not. Or is there another approach I can take here?\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-03-09T15:05:13.367Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":226,"readers_count":225,"score":95.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":494853,"topic_slug":"2-addressable-led-strips","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":73619,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/2-addressable-led-strips/494853/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3551919,"name":"MrBasse","username":"MrBasse","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrbasse/{size}/65032_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-09T16:29:12.293Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eWe run ours in parallel and have been happy with the results.  They have been very helpful in knowing the state of the robot on the field and what actions it is completing.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-03-09T16:29:12.293Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":193,"readers_count":192,"score":83.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":494853,"topic_slug":"2-addressable-led-strips","display_username":"MrBasse","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16614,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC #3572"},"post_url":"/t/2-addressable-led-strips/494853/2","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3551936,"name":"Sky Captain","username":"Sky_Captain","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sky_captain/{size}/4746_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-09T16:50:43.244Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eWe just discovered this as well and use a “Y” \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003ePWM\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Pulse Width Modulation\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e cable and it seems to work. Make sure you aren’t trying to pull more current than your RIO can provide.  Depending on the density of the LEDs, 2m of strip could pull quite a bit of power.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-03-09T16:50:43.244Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":179,"readers_count":178,"score":70.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":494853,"topic_slug":"2-addressable-led-strips","display_username":"Sky Captain","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13913,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FTA|CSA|386 Mentor|346 Alumni "},"post_url":"/t/2-addressable-led-strips/494853/3","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3551941,"name":"MrBasse","username":"MrBasse","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrbasse/{size}/65032_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-09T16:53:59.706Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eGreat point! How much current can the rio provide? Amazon has lots of options available or if you have old kit of parts converters laying around it is easy to get 5v without using the Rio to supply it.  Something like this \u003ca href=\"https://a.co/d/8yrJthL\" class=\"inline-onebox\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003eAmazon.com: DC Voltage Regulator Buck Converter DC 12V 24V Step-Down to 5V 20A 100W Reducer stabilized Power Supply Converter Waterproof Module Transformer : Electronics\u003c/a\u003e would do the job and there are a bunch of different ones available there too.  We use the same converter to power our LEDs and two orange Pi’s for vision so the one we use is a little overkill.  If you do use a converter be sure to ground both the signal at the Rio and the power at the converter for your
